intro: Micromeria perezii, commonly known as the Peruvian germander, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine pubescence. Micromeria perezii is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
